title: Brace - Shock Tower (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace).
Remove the cabin intake duct. See Duct - Air Intake (Remove and Replace).
Remove LV power. See LV Battery (Remove and Install).
Use a clip pry tool to release the clips (x4) that attach the coolant hose to the A/C compressor bracket.
Release the connector locking tab, and then disconnect the HVIL connector near the LH front strut tower.

tips_notes.content: DO NOT push down on the red locking tab. Pull the tab away from the connector until the connector is unlocked, and then continue pulling to release the connector.
Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Pick Miniature Soft Grip, 90 degree
6 in

steps.instruction: Release the connector locking tab, then disconnect the A/C logic electrical connector from the A/C compressor.

tips_notes.content: DO NOT push down on the red locking tab. Pull the tab away from the connector until the connector is unlocked, and then continue pulling to release the connector.
Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Pick Miniature Soft Grip, 90 degree
6 in

steps.instruction: Use a clip pry tool to release the retaining clip that attaches the A/C compressor logic harness to the A/C compressor HV harness bracket.
Remove the bolt that attaches the ground strap to the A/C compressor, and then set the ground strap aside.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Torx T25 socket

steps.instruction: Use a clip pry tool to release the clip that attaches the coolant hose to the A/C compressor bracket.
Remove the retaining clips (x5) that attach the A/C compressor HV harness to the shock tower brace.

tips_notes.content: Pull upward on the clip to assist with removal. Do not pull upward on the HV cable.

steps.instruction: Place a fender cover (1115212-00-A) on the front underhood storage unit reinforcement beam to prevent damage to other components.

With an assistant, remove the bolts (x2) that attach the A/C compressor assembly to the strut tower brace, and then carefully maneuver the assembly towards the front of the vehicle, under the strut tower support brace. Rest the A/C compressor assembly on the front underhood storage unit reinforcement beam. , to a

tips_notes.content: Do not rest the A/C compressor on the HV connector.
Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket

steps.instruction: Secure the supermanifold assembly with bungee cords.

tips_notes.content: Install bungee cord to RH hood strut bracket. Route bungee cord around accumulator housing and secure to the RH body side. Do not secure bungee cord around coolant pumps or plastic housing on supermanifold. Use a mirror as needed to visual check bungee cord around accumulator housing.

steps.instruction: Remove the bolts (x2) that attach the supermanifold to the shock tower brace.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket

steps.instruction: Remove the LH and RH bolts (x4) that attach the shock tower brace to the body.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket

steps.instruction: Remove the LH and RH outer bolts (x2) that attach the shock tower brace to the body, and then remove the shock tower brace from the vehicle.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket

steps.instruction: Position the shock tower brace to the vehicle, and then loosely install the LH and RH bolts (x6) that attach the shock tower brace to the body.
Torque the LH and RH outer bolts (x2) that attach the shock tower brace to the body.62 Nm (45.7 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket

steps.instruction: Torque the LH and RH bolts (x4) that attach the shock tower brace to the body.55 Nm (40.6 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket

steps.instruction: With an assistant supporting the A/C compressor assembly under the strut tower brace, install the bolts (x2) that attach the supermanifold to the shock tower brace.31 Nm (22.9 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket

steps.instruction: Remove the bungee cords from the supermanifold assembly.

With an assistant supporting the A/C compressor assembly under the strut tower brace, hand-start the bolts (x2) that attach the A/C compressor assembly to the brace, and then torque the bolts.31 Nm (22.9 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket

steps.instruction: Remove the fender cover from the front underhood storage unit support beam.
Install the retaining clips (x5) that attach the A/C compressor HV harness to the shock tower support brace.
Install the clip that attaches the coolant hose to the A/C compressor bracket.
Position the ground strap on the A/C compressor, and then install the bolt that attaches the ground strap to the A/C compressor.7 Nm (5.2 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Torx T25 socket

steps.instruction: Install the retaining clip that attaches the A/C compressor logic harness to the A/C compressor HV harness bracket.
Connect the A/C compressor logic electrical connector to the A/C compressor, and then engage the locking tab.

tips_notes.content: Push the red locking tab into the connector to engage the locking mechanism. DO NOT push down or pull up on the red locking tab.

steps.instruction: Connect the HVIL connector near the LH front strut tower, and then engage the locking tab.

tips_notes.content: Push the red locking tab into the connector to engage the locking mechanism. DO NOT push down or pull up on the red locking tab.

steps.instruction: Install the clips (x4) that attach the coolant hose to the A/C compressor bracket.
Install LV power. See LV Battery (Remove and Install).
Remove the cabin intake duct. See Duct - Air Intake (Remove and Replace).
Install the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace).

torque_specifications.description: Bolt that attaches the ground strap to the A/C compressor
Bolts (x2) that attach the A/C compressor assembly to the brace
Bolts (x2) that attach the supermanifold to the shock tower brace
The LH and RH bolts (x4) that attach the shock tower brace to the body
The LH and RH outer bolts that attach the shock tower brace to the body

title: Cowl Screen Bracket (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the cowl screen panel. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace).
Remove the positive jumper post cap.
Remove the stud bolt that attaches the positive jumper post to the cowl screen bracket.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: External Torx E5

steps.instruction: Remove the bolt that attaches the cowl screen bracket to the body.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Release the tabs (x2) that attach the cowl screen bracket to the vehicle, and then remove it from the vehicle.
Install the tabs (x2) that attach the cowl screen bracket to the vehicle.
Install the bolt that attaches the cowl screen bracket to the body.7 Nm (5.2 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Install the stud bolt that attaches the positive jumper post to the cowl screen bracket.8 Nm (5.9 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: External Torx E5

steps.instruction: Install the positive jumper post cap.
Install the cowl screen panel. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace).

torque_specifications.description: Stud bolt that attaches the positive jumper post to the cowl screen bracket
Bolt that attaches the cowl screen bracket to the body

full_text: Cowl Screen Bracket (Remove and Replace) Torque Calculator2025-03-12 Cowl Screen Bracket (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010040102 FRT 0.20 NOTE: Unless otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including the linked procedures. Do not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate Times to learn more about FRTs and how they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com. NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications: Cowl Screen Bracket (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Stud bolt that attaches the positive jumper post to the cowl screen bracket 8 Nm (5.9 lbs-ft) External Torx E5 Reuse Bolt that attaches the cowl screen bracket to the body 7 Nm (5.2 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Reuse Remove | Remove the cowl screen panel. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace). Remove the positive jumper post cap. Remove the stud bolt that attaches the positive jumper post to the cowl screen bracket. , Note Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: External Torx E5 Remove the bolt that attaches the cowl screen bracket to the body. , Note Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Release the tabs (x2) that attach the cowl screen bracket to the vehicle, and then remove it from the vehicle. Install | Install the tabs (x2) that attach the cowl screen bracket to the vehicle. Install the bolt that attaches the cowl screen bracket to the body.7 Nm (5.2 lbs-ft) , Note Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Install the stud bolt that attaches the positive jumper post to the cowl screen bracket.8 Nm (5.9 lbs-ft) , Note Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: External Torx E5 Install the positive jumper post cap. Install the cowl screen panel. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace). title: Fem Bracket - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace).
Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify).
Remove the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install).
Remove the LH front wheel. See Wheel Assembly (Remove and Install).
Remove the front fascia assembly from the vehicle. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace).

tips_notes.content: Do not separate the valance, the grille and the harness from the front fascia.

steps.instruction: Disconnect the cooling fan connector.
Disconnect the LH FEM harness connector.
Disconnect the LH front pedestrian protection pressure tube sensor.

tips_notes.content: Do not push down on the red tab. Pull it to disengage the lock, and then pull it again to release the connector.

steps.instruction: Release the harness clip from the LH crush can.
Release the harness clip from the FEM.
Release 4 of the LH front wheel liner clips.
Partially remove the LH front wheel liner.
Release the LH front wheel speed sensor harness clips (x2) from the body.
Disconnect the LH Front wheel speed sensor connector.
Remove the FEM bracket LH crash accelerometer sensor. See Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Disconnect the LH headlamp connector.

tips_notes.content: Pull the tab to disengage the lock mechanism, and then pull it again to release the connector. Do not press down on the tab.

steps.instruction: Release the clip that attaches the front harness to the LH FEM bracket assembly.
Remove the harness from the LH FEM bracket assembly.
Remove the bolts (x3) that attach the LH FEM bracket assembly to the body.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Remove the bolt that attaches the FEM bracket to the LH front fender.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Remove the bolt that attaches the LH FEM bracket assembly to the FEM, and then remove the LH FEM bracket assembly from the vehicle.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension

steps.instruction: 13 mm deep socket
10 in extension
Hand-tighten the bolt that attaches the LH FEM bracket assembly to the FEM.

tips_notes.content: Torque at later steps.

steps.instruction: Hand-tighten the bolt that attaches the FEM bracket to the LH front fender.

tips_notes.content: Torque at later steps.

steps.instruction: Hand-tighten the bolts (x3) that attach the LH FEM bracket assembly to the body.

tips_notes.content: Torque at later steps.

steps.instruction: Torque the bolts (x3) that attach the LH FEM bracket assembly to the body.30 Nm (22.1 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Torque the bolt that attaches the FEM bracket to the LH front fender.6.5 Nm (4.8 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Torque the bolt that attaches the LH FEM bracket assembly to the FEM.16 Nm (11.8 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension

steps.instruction: Route the front harness through the LH FEM bracket assembly.
Secure the clip that attaches the front harness to the LH FEM bracket assembly.
Install the FEM bracket LH crash accelerometer sensor. See Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Clip the front harness to the LH crush can.
Clip the front harness to the FEM.
Connect the LH headlamp connector.
Connect the LH front pedestrian protection pressure tube sensor.
Install the clips (x2) that attach the LH front wheel speed sensor harness to the body.
Connect the LH front wheel speed sensor connector.
Install the LH front wheel liner.
Install the 4 LH front wheel liner clips.
Connect the LH FEM harness connector.
Connect the cooling fan connector.
Install the front fascia assembly to the vehicle. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace).
Install the LH front wheel. See Wheel Assembly (Remove and Install).
Install the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install).
Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify).
Install the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace).
13 mm deep socket
10 in extension

torque_specifications.description: Bolts that attach the FEM bracket assembly to the body
Bolts that attach the FEM bracket to the front fender
Bolts that attach the FEM bracket assembly to the FEM

Do not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate Times to learn more about FRTs and how they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com. NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications: Fem Bracket - LH (Remove and Replace) / Fem Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolts that attach the FEM bracket assembly to the body 30 Nm (22.1 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket Reuse Bolts that attach the FEM bracket to the front fender 6.5 Nm (4.8 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Reuse Bolts that attach the FEM bracket assembly to the FEM 16 Nm (11.8 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension Reuse Remove | Remove the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace). Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify). Remove the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install). Remove the LH front wheel. See Wheel Assembly (Remove and Install). Remove the front fascia assembly from the vehicle. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace). , NoteDo not separate the valance, the grille and the harness from the front fascia. Disconnect the cooling fan connector. Disconnect the LH FEM harness connector. Disconnect the LH front pedestrian protection pressure tube sensor. , NoteDo not push down on the red tab. Pull it to disengage the lock, and then pull it again to release the connector. Release the harness clip from the LH crush can. Release the harness clip from the FEM. Release 4 of the LH front wheel liner clips. Partially remove the LH front wheel liner. Release the LH front wheel speed sensor harness clips (x2) from the body. Disconnect the LH Front wheel speed sensor connector. Remove the FEM bracket LH crash accelerometer sensor. See Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace). Disconnect the LH headlamp connector. , NotePull the tab to disengage the lock mechanism, and then pull it again to release the connector. Do not press down on the tab. Release the clip that attaches the front harness to the LH FEM bracket assembly. Remove the harness from the LH FEM bracket assembly. Remove the bolts (x3) that attach the LH FEM bracket assembly to the body. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Remove the bolt that attaches the FEM bracket to the LH front fender. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the bolt that attaches the LH FEM bracket assembly to the FEM, and then remove the LH FEM bracket assembly from the vehicle. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension Install | Hand-tighten the bolt that attaches the LH FEM bracket assembly to the FEM. , NoteTorque at later steps. Hand-tighten the bolt that attaches the FEM bracket to the LH front fender. , NoteTorque at later steps. Hand-tighten the bolts (x3) that attach the LH FEM bracket assembly to the body. , NoteTorque at later steps. Torque the bolts (x3) that attach the LH FEM bracket assembly to the body.30 Nm (22.1 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Torque the bolt that attaches the FEM bracket to the LH front fender.6.5 Nm (4.8 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Torque the bolt that attaches the LH FEM bracket assembly to the FEM.16 Nm (11.8 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension Route the front harness through the LH FEM bracket assembly. Secure the clip that attaches the front harness to the LH FEM bracket assembly. Install the FEM bracket LH crash accelerometer sensor. See Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace). Clip the front harness to the LH crush can. Clip the front harness to the FEM. Connect the LH headlamp connector. Connect the LH front pedestrian protection pressure tube sensor. Install the clips (x2) that attach the LH front wheel speed sensor harness to the body. Connect the LH front wheel speed sensor connector. Install the LH front wheel liner. Install the 4 LH front wheel liner clips. Connect the LH FEM harness connector. Connect the cooling fan connector. Install the front fascia assembly to the vehicle. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace). Install the LH front wheel. See Wheel Assembly (Remove and Install). Install the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install). Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify). Install the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace). title: Fem Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace).
Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify).
Remove the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install).
Remove the RH front wheel. See Wheel Assembly (Remove and Install).
Remove the front fascia assembly from the vehicle. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace).

tips_notes.content: Do not separate the valance, the grille and the harness from the front fascia.

steps.instruction: Disconnect the RH FEM harness connector.
Disconnect the RH front pedestrian protection pressure tube sensor.

tips_notes.content: Do not push down on the red tab. Pull it to disengage the lock, and then pull it again to release the connector.

steps.instruction: Release the harness clips (x2) from the RH headlamp.
Release the harness clip from the RH crush can.
Release 4 of the RH front wheel liner clips.
Partially remove the RH front wheel liner.
Release the RH front wheel speed sensor harness clips (x2) from the body.
Disconnect the RH front wheel speed sensor connector.
Remove the FEM bracket RH crash accelerometer sensor. See Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Disconnect the RH headlamp connector.

tips_notes.content: Pull the tab to disengage the lock mechanism, and then pull it again to release the connector. Do not press down on the tab.

steps.instruction: Release the harness clip from the FEM.
Release the front harness clip from the RH FEM bracket assembly.
Remove the harness from the RH FEM bracket assembly.
Remove the bolts (x3) that attach the RH FEM bracket assembly to the body.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Remove the bolt that attaches the FEM bracket to the RH front fender.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Remove the bolt that attaches the RH FEM bracket assembly to the FEM, and then remove the RH FEM bracket assembly from the vehicle.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension

steps.instruction: 13 mm deep socket
10 in extension
Hand-tighten the bolt that attaches the RH FEM bracket assembly to the FEM.

tips_notes.content: Torque at later steps.

steps.instruction: Hand-tighten the bolt that attaches the FEM bracket to the RH front fender.

tips_notes.content: Torque at later steps.

steps.instruction: Hand-tighten the bolts (x3) that attach the RH FEM bracket assembly to the body.

tips_notes.content: Torque at later steps.

steps.instruction: Torque the bolts (x3) that attach the RH FEM bracket assembly to the body.30 Nm (22.1 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Torque the bolt that attaches the FEM bracket to the RH front fender.6.5 Nm (4.8 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Torque the bolt that attaches the RH FEM bracket assembly to the FEM.16 Nm (11.8 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension

steps.instruction: Route the front harness through the RH FEM bracket assembly.
Secure the front harness clip to the RH FEM bracket assembly.
Connect the RH headlamp connector.
Install the FEM bracket RH crash accelerometer sensor. See Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Clip the front harness to the FEM.
Clip the front harness to the RH crush can.
Connect the RH front pedestrian protection pressure tube sensor.
Install the clips (x2) that attach the RH front wheel speed sensor harness to the body.
Connect the RH Front wheel speed sensor connector.
Install the RH front wheel liner.
Install the 4 RH front wheel liner clips.
Clip the harness to the RH headlamp.
Connect the RH FEM harness connector.
Install the front fascia assembly to the vehicle. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace).
Install the RH front wheel. See Wheel Assembly (Remove and Install).
Install the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install).
Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify).
Install the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace).
13 mm deep socket
10 in extension

torque_specifications.description: Bolts that attach the FEM bracket assembly to the body
Bolts that attach the FEM bracket to the front fender
Bolts that attach the FEM bracket assembly to the FEM

full_text: Fem Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace) Torque Calculator2025-03-12 Fem Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010050202 FRT 0.80 NOTE: Unless otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including the linked procedures. Do not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate Times to learn more about FRTs and how they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com. NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications: Fem Bracket - LH (Remove and Replace) / Fem Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolts that attach the FEM bracket assembly to the body 30 Nm (22.1 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket Reuse Bolts that attach the FEM bracket to the front fender 6.5 Nm (4.8 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Reuse Bolts that attach the FEM bracket assembly to the FEM 16 Nm (11.8 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension Reuse Remove | Remove the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace). Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify). Remove the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install). Remove the RH front wheel. See Wheel Assembly (Remove and Install). Remove the front fascia assembly from the vehicle. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace). , NoteDo not separate the valance, the grille and the harness from the front fascia. Disconnect the RH FEM harness connector. Disconnect the RH front pedestrian protection pressure tube sensor. , NoteDo not push down on the red tab. Pull it to disengage the lock, and then pull it again to release the connector. Release the harness clips (x2) from the RH headlamp. Release the harness clip from the RH crush can. Release 4 of the RH front wheel liner clips. Partially remove the RH front wheel liner. Release the RH front wheel speed sensor harness clips (x2) from the body. Disconnect the RH front wheel speed sensor connector. Remove the FEM bracket RH crash accelerometer sensor. See Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace). Disconnect the RH headlamp connector. , NotePull the tab to disengage the lock mechanism, and then pull it again to release the connector. Do not press down on the tab. Release the harness clip from the FEM. Release the front harness clip from the RH FEM bracket assembly. Remove the harness from the RH FEM bracket assembly. Remove the bolts (x3) that attach the RH FEM bracket assembly to the body. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Remove the bolt that attaches the FEM bracket to the RH front fender. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the bolt that attaches the RH FEM bracket assembly to the FEM, and then remove the RH FEM bracket assembly from the vehicle. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension Install | Hand-tighten the bolt that attaches the RH FEM bracket assembly to the FEM. , NoteTorque at later steps. Hand-tighten the bolt that attaches the FEM bracket to the RH front fender. , NoteTorque at later steps. Hand-tighten the bolts (x3) that attach the RH FEM bracket assembly to the body. , NoteTorque at later steps. Torque the bolts (x3) that attach the RH FEM bracket assembly to the body.30 Nm (22.1 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Torque the bolt that attaches the FEM bracket to the RH front fender.6.5 Nm (4.8 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Torque the bolt that attaches the RH FEM bracket assembly to the FEM.16 Nm (11.8 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension Route the front harness through the RH FEM bracket assembly. Secure the front harness clip to the RH FEM bracket assembly. Connect the RH headlamp connector. Install the FEM bracket RH crash accelerometer sensor. See Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace). Clip the front harness to the FEM. Clip the front harness to the RH crush can. Connect the RH front pedestrian protection pressure tube sensor. Install the clips (x2) that attach the RH front wheel speed sensor harness to the body. Connect the RH Front wheel speed sensor connector. Install the RH front wheel liner. Install the 4 RH front wheel liner clips. Clip the harness to the RH headlamp. Connect the RH FEM harness connector. Install the front fascia assembly to the vehicle. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace). Install the RH front wheel. See Wheel Assembly (Remove and Install). Install the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install). Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify). Install the underhood storage unit. title: Fender - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Open the LH front door and lower the LH front window.
Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify).
Remove the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install).
Remove the front fascia assembly. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace).

tips_notes.content: No need to separate the valance, the front fascia harness and the grille from the front fascia assembly.

steps.instruction: Remove the LH headlamp. See Headlamp Assembly - LH (Remove and Replace).
Remove the LH fascia side bracket from fender. See Bracket - Fascia Side to Fender - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Bracket - Fascia Side to Fender - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Disconnect the cowl screen from the LH carrier bracket.
Remove the bolts (x5) that attach the LH front fender bracket to the body.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Remove the nuts (x2) that attach the LH lower front fender bracket to the body.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Disconnect the side repeater connectors (x2).
Remove the LH front fender assembly from the vehicle.
Release the clip and tabs (x2) to remove the LH side repeater.

tips_notes.content: Press to release the clip.

steps.instruction: Remove the frunk fender clips (x3) from the LH front fender.

tips_notes.content: Replace any damaged clip.

steps.instruction: Release the clips (x2) to remove the headlamp rubber grommet from the LH front fender.
Secure the clips (x2) to install the headlamp rubber grommet onto the LH front fender.
Install the frunk fender clips (x3) onto the LH front fender.

tips_notes.content: Replace any damaged clip.

steps.instruction: Secure the clip and the tabs (x2) to install the LH side repeater onto the fender.

tips_notes.content: When the side repeater is installed in place, a noticeable "click" sound can be heard.

steps.instruction: Connect the LH side repeater connectors (x2).

tips_notes.content: Ensure the lock on camera connection is secure.

steps.instruction: Position the LH front fender assembly onto the vehicle.
Install the nuts (x2) that attach the LH lower front fender bracket to the body.9.8 Nm (7.2 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Install the bolts (x5) that attach the LH front fender bracket to the body.9.8 Nm (7.2 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Secure the cowl screen clip to the LH carrier bracket.
Install the LH fascia side bracket from fender. See Bracket - Fascia Side to Fender - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Bracket - Fascia Side to Fender - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the LH headlamp. See Headlamp Assembly - LH (Remove and Replace).
Install the front fascia assembly. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace).

tips_notes.content: After installing the clips (x4) that attach the LH and RH front wheel arch liner to the front fascia assembly, check gap and flushness for the fender, and adjust if necessary. Refer to CVIS for current specification.

steps.instruction: Install the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install).
Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify).
Remove all the protective tapes.
Raise the LH front window and close the LH front door.
Remove the vehicle from the lift.

torque_specifications.description: Bolts (x5) and nuts (x2) that attach the LH front fender bracket to the body

full_text: Fender - LH (Remove and Replace) Torque Calculator2025-07-23 Fender - LH (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010030102 FRT 0.96 NOTE: Unless otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including the linked procedures. Do not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate Times to learn more about FRTs and how they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com. NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications: Fender - LH (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolts (x5) and nuts (x2) that attach the LH front fender bracket to the body 9.8 Nm (7.2 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Reuse Remove | Open the LH front door and lower the LH front window. Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify). Remove the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install). Remove the front fascia assembly. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace). , NoteNo need to separate the valance, the front fascia harness and the grille from the front fascia assembly. Remove the LH headlamp. See Headlamp Assembly - LH (Remove and Replace). Remove the LH fascia side bracket from fender. See Bracket - Fascia Side to Fender - LH (Remove and Replace). Disconnect the cowl screen from the LH carrier bracket. Remove the bolts (x5) that attach the LH front fender bracket to the body. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the nuts (x2) that attach the LH lower front fender bracket to the body. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Disconnect the side repeater connectors (x2). Remove the LH front fender assembly from the vehicle. Release the clip and tabs (x2) to remove the LH side repeater. , NotePress to release the clip. Remove the frunk fender clips (x3) from the LH front fender. , NoteReplace any damaged clip. Release the clips (x2) to remove the headlamp rubber grommet from the LH front fender. Install | Secure the clips (x2) to install the headlamp rubber grommet onto the LH front fender. Install the frunk fender clips (x3) onto the LH front fender. , NoteReplace any damaged clip. Secure the clip and the tabs (x2) to install the LH side repeater onto the fender. , NoteWhen the side repeater is installed in place, a noticeable "click" sound can be heard. Connect the LH side repeater connectors (x2). , NoteEnsure the lock on camera connection is secure. Position the LH front fender assembly onto the vehicle. Install the nuts (x2) that attach the LH lower front fender bracket to the body.9.8 Nm (7.2 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Install the bolts (x5) that attach the LH front fender bracket to the body.9.8 Nm (7.2 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Secure the cowl screen clip to the LH carrier bracket. Install the LH fascia side bracket from fender. See Bracket - Fascia Side to Fender - LH (Remove and Replace). Install the LH headlamp. See Headlamp Assembly - LH (Remove and Replace). Install the front fascia assembly. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace). , NoteAfter installing the clips (x4) that attach the LH and RH front wheel arch liner to the front fascia assembly, check gap and flushness for the fender, and adjust if necessary. Refer to CVIS for current specification. Install the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install). Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify). Remove all the protective tapes. Raise the LH front window and close the LH front door. Remove the vehicle from the lift. title: Door - Front - LH (Remove and Install)

steps.instruction: Open the LH front door and lower the LH front window.
Remove the driver footwell hush panel. See Hush Panel - Footwell - Driver (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Hush Panel - Footwell - Driver (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the LH lower A-pillar trim. See A Pillar Lower Trim - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: A Pillar Lower Trim - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify).
Disconnect the J7 front door connector.
Release the grommet and remove the LH front door harness from the A-pillar area.

tips_notes.content: Push the harness through the bulkhead from the A-pillar area.

steps.instruction: Apply tape to the LH front fender area.
Apply tape surrounding the hinges to mark the installation position.
Remove the bolt that attaches the LH front door check strap to the body.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket

steps.instruction: Release the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front upper and lower door hinges to the door.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm

steps.instruction: With assistance, lift the LH front door assembly up from the vehicle, and place it on a padded surface.
With assistance, position the LH front door assembly to the vehicle, and hand-tighten the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front lower and upper door hinges to the door.
Install the bolt that attaches the LH front door check strap to the body.24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket

steps.instruction: Route the LH front door harness through the outer A-pillar and install the grommet.

tips_notes.content: Verify the seal if fully seated around the black grommet prior to installing.

steps.instruction: Connect the J7 front door connector.
Install the LH lower A-pillar trim. See A Pillar Lower Trim - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: A Pillar Lower Trim - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the driver footwell hush panel. See Hush Panel - Footwell - Driver (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Hush Panel - Footwell - Driver (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify).
Close the LH front door.
Close the LH front door to check for gap/flushness.

tips_notes.content: Adjust the LH front door if necessary. Refer to CVIS for current specification.

steps.instruction: Open the LH front door.
Torque the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front lower and upper door hinges to the door.26 Nm (19.2 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm

steps.instruction: Remove all masking tapes.
Raise the LH front window and close the LH front door.

torque_specifications.description: Bolt that attaches the LH front door check strap to the body
Nuts (x2) that attach the LH front upper and lower door hinges to the door

Do not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate Times to learn more about FRTs and how they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com. NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. Torque Specifications: Door - Front - LH (Remove and Install) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolt that attaches the LH front door check strap to the body 24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) Torx T40 socket Reuse Nuts (x2) that attach the LH front upper and lower door hinges to the door 26 Nm (19.2 lbs-ft) Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm Reuse Remove | Open the LH front door and lower the LH front window. Remove the driver footwell hush panel. See Hush Panel - Footwell - Driver (Remove and Replace). Remove the LH lower A-pillar trim. See A Pillar Lower Trim - LH (Remove and Replace). Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify). Disconnect the J7 front door connector. Release the grommet and remove the LH front door harness from the A-pillar area. , NotePush the harness through the bulkhead from the A-pillar area. Apply tape to the LH front fender area. Apply tape surrounding the hinges to mark the installation position. Remove the bolt that attaches the LH front door check strap to the body. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket Release the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front upper and lower door hinges to the door. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm With assistance, lift the LH front door assembly up from the vehicle, and place it on a padded surface. Install | With assistance, position the LH front door assembly to the vehicle, and hand-tighten the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front lower and upper door hinges to the door. Install the bolt that attaches the LH front door check strap to the body.24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket Route the LH front door harness through the outer A-pillar and install the grommet. , NoteVerify the seal if fully seated around the black grommet prior to installing. Connect the J7 front door connector. Install the LH lower A-pillar trim. See A Pillar Lower Trim - LH (Remove and Replace). Install the driver footwell hush panel. See Hush Panel - Footwell - Driver (Remove and Replace). Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify). Close the LH front door. Close the LH front door to check for gap/flushness. , NoteAdjust the LH front door if necessary. Refer to CVIS for current specification. Open the LH front door. Torque the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front lower and upper door hinges to the door.26 Nm (19.2 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm Remove all masking tapes. Raise the LH front window and close the LH front door. title: Door - Front - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Open the LH front door and lower the LH front window.
Move the LH front seat backward.
Remove the secondary seal from the LH front door. See Secondary Seal - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Secondary Seal - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the LH front door moving side glass. See Glass - Door - Front - LH (Model Y Premium) (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Glass - Door - Front - LH (Model Y Premium) (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify).
Remove the LH exterior mirror. See Exterior Mirror - LH (Remove and Replace).
Remove the LH front pressure sensor. See Door Pressure Sensor (Remove and Replace).
Disconnect the LH front regulator motor connector.

tips_notes.content: Disengage the red locking tab, and then press down the black tab to release the connector.

steps.instruction: Remove the LH front door speaker woofer. See Speaker - Front Door (Remove and Replace).
Remove the LH front door closeout panel assembly. See Closeout Panel - Window Regulator - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Closeout Panel - Window Regulator - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace)

tips_notes.content: No need to remove the window regulator from the door closeout panel assembly.

steps.instruction: Remove the LH front outer door handle. See Door Handle Outer - Passive - LH - Front (Remove and Install).

hyperlinks.text: Door Handle Outer - Passive - LH - Front (Remove and Install)

steps.instruction: Remove the LH front door latch. See Door Latch - Front - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Door Latch - Front - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the LH front door harness. See Harness - Front LH Door - Premium - LHD (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Harness - Front LH Door - Premium - LHD (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Apply tape to LH front fender.
Remove the LH front door check strap. See Check Strap - Front (Remove and Replace).
Apply tape surrounding the hinges to mark the installation position.
Release the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front upper and lower door hinges to the door.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm

steps.instruction: With assistance, lift the LH front door assembly up from the vehicle, and place it on a padded surface.
With assistance, position the LH front door assembly to the vehicle, and hand-tighten the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front lower and upper door hinges to the door.
Install the LH front door check strap. See Check Strap - Front (Remove and Replace).
Install the LH front door harness. See Harness - Front LH Door - Premium - LHD (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Harness - Front LH Door - Premium - LHD (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the LH front door latch. See Door Latch - Front - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Door Latch - Front - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the LH front outer door handle. See Door Handle Outer - Passive - LH - Front (Remove and Install).

hyperlinks.text: Door Handle Outer - Passive - LH - Front (Remove and Install)

steps.instruction: Install the LH front door closeout panel assembly. See Closeout Panel - Window Regulator - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Closeout Panel - Window Regulator - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the LH front door speaker woofer. See Speaker - Front Door (Remove and Replace).
Connect the LH front regulator motor connector.
Install the LH front pressure sensor. See Door Pressure Sensor (Remove and Replace).
Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify).
Install the LH exterior mirror. See Exterior Mirror - LH (Remove and Replace).
Install the LH front door moving side glass. See Glass - Door - Front - LH (Model Y Premium) (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Glass - Door - Front - LH (Model Y Premium) (Remove and Replace)

tips_notes.content: Return to the current procedure after installing the LH front door outer and inner belt seals.

steps.instruction: Close the LH front door to check for gap/flushness.

tips_notes.content: Adjust the LH front door if necessary. Refer to CVIS for current specification.

steps.instruction: Open the LH front door.
Torque the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front lower and upper door hinges to the door.26 Nm (19.2 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm

steps.instruction: Remove all masking tapes.
Continue installing the LH front door moving side glass. See Glass - Door - Front - LH (Model Y Premium) (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Glass - Door - Front - LH (Model Y Premium) (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the secondary seal from the LH front door. See Secondary Seal - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Secondary Seal - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the HEPA filter assembly. See HEPA Filter Assembly (Remove and Replace).
Move the LH front seat to original position.
Raise the LH front window and close the LH front door.

torque_specifications.description: Bolt that attaches the LH front door check strap to the body
Nuts (x2) that attach the LH front upper and lower door hinges to the door

Install | With assistance, position the LH front door assembly to the vehicle, and hand-tighten the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front lower and upper door hinges to the door. Continue installing the LH front door moving side glass. See Glass - Door - Front - LH (Model Y Premium) (Remove and Replace). Install the secondary seal from the LH front door. See Secondary Seal - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace). Install the HEPA filter assembly. See HEPA Filter Assembly (Remove and Replace). Move the LH front seat to original position. Raise the LH front window and close the LH front door. title: Hood (Remove and Install)

steps.instruction: Remove hood striker from hood assembly. See Hood Striker (Remove and Replace).
Remove LH and RH hood bump stops from hood.
Remove hood baffle.
Apply tape surrounding hood hinge to keep accurate alignment.
With assistance, remove the nuts (x4) that attach the hood to the LH and RH hood hinges.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

steps.instruction: With assistance, remove the hood from the vehicle, and then place it on a padded surface.
With assistance, loosely install nuts securing hood to RH and LH hood hinge.27 Nm (19.9 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

steps.instruction: Install hood baffle.
Install RH and LH hood bumps stop to hood.
Install hood striker from hood assembly. See Hood Striker (Remove and Replace).

torque_specifications.description: Nuts (x4) that secure hood to LH and RH hood hinges

full_text: Hood (Remove and Install) Torque Calculator2025-03-12 Hood (Remove and Install) Correction code 1010020301 FRT 0.30 NOTE: Unless otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including the linked procedures. Do not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate Times to learn more about FRTs and how they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com. NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and healthy working practices. This procedure assumes the hood striker, hinges, bump stops, and plugs are undamaged. Inspect these components from the old hood and if necessary, replace with new parts. Table 1. Torque Specifications: Hood (Remove and Install) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Nuts (x4) that secure hood to LH and RH hood hinges 27 Nm (19.9 lbs-ft) 13 mm socket Reuse Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Remove | Remove hood striker from hood assembly. See Hood Striker (Remove and Replace). Remove LH and RH hood bump stops from hood. Remove hood baffle. Apply tape surrounding hood hinge to keep accurate alignment. With assistance, remove the nuts (x4) that attach the hood to the LH and RH hood hinges. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket With assistance, remove the hood from the vehicle, and then place it on a padded surface. Install | , to a CAUTION If using this procedure to install an unpainted part, make sure to apply seam sealer to all seams prior to installing and painting the part. Refer to the Collision Repair manual for more information. With assistance, loosely install nuts securing hood to RH and LH hood hinge.27 Nm (19.9 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Install hood baffle. Install RH and LH hood bumps stop to hood. Install hood striker from hood assembly. See Hood Striker (Remove and Replace). title: Launcher Bracket - LH (LHD) (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the wiper module. See Wiper Module - LHD (Remove and Replace).
Remove the LH pedestrian protection actuator. See Actuator - Pedestrian Protection - Active Hood - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Actuator - Pedestrian Protection - Active Hood - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the bolts (x2) that attach the LH launcher bracket to the body.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket

steps.instruction: Remove the LH launcher bracket from the vehicle.
Align the guide tabs (x2) and position the LH launcher bracket to the body.
Install the bolts (x2) that attach the LH launcher bracket to the body.9 Nm (6.6 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket

steps.instruction: Install the LH pedestrian protection actuator. See Actuator - Pedestrian Protection - Active Hood - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Actuator - Pedestrian Protection - Active Hood - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the wiper module. See Wiper Module - LHD (Remove and Replace).

torque_specifications.description: Bolts (x2) that attach the launcher bracket to the body

full_text: Launcher Bracket - LH (LHD) (Remove and Replace) Torque Calculator2025-06-12 Launcher Bracket - LH (LHD) (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010102402 FRT 0.42 NOTE: Unless otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including the linked procedures. Do not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate Times to learn more about FRTs and how they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com. NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications: Launcher Bracket - LH (LHD) (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolts (x2) that attach the launcher bracket to the body 9 Nm (6.6 lbs-ft) 10 mm socket Reuse Remove | Remove the wiper module. See Wiper Module - LHD (Remove and Replace). Remove the LH pedestrian protection actuator. See Actuator - Pedestrian Protection - Active Hood - LH (Remove and Replace). Remove the bolts (x2) that attach the LH launcher bracket to the body. , Note Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket Remove the LH launcher bracket from the vehicle. Install | Align the guide tabs (x2) and position the LH launcher bracket to the body. Install the bolts (x2) that attach the LH launcher bracket to the body.9 Nm (6.6 lbs-ft) , Note Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket Install the LH pedestrian protection actuator. See Actuator - Pedestrian Protection - Active Hood - LH (Remove and Replace). Install the wiper module. See Wiper Module - LHD (Remove and Replace). title: Liftgate (Remove and Install)

steps.instruction: Open the liftgate.
Use a telescoping hood prop to support the liftgate.
Remove the rear headliner. See Rear Headliner (Remove and Replace).
Carefully release the clip and location pin that attach the RH rear edge of the headliner to the vehicle.

tips_notes.content: This is to gain access to the liftgate harness connectors.

steps.instruction: Remove and discard the bolt that attaches the liftgate harness ground bolt to the liftgate.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket

steps.instruction: Disconnect the liftgate harness connectors (x3).
Release the RH rear liftgate grommet from the body.
Apply masking tape around the liftgate and liftgate hinge to mark the installation positioning.
Place shop towels on the LH and RH side liftgate jambs.
Release the spring clips (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper ball studs to the liftgate, and then lay the struts down on the door jamb. Figure 1. LH shown, RH similar
Remove the telescoping hood prop.
With assistance, remove the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle, and then place the liftgate on a stand.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

steps.instruction: With assistance, position the liftgate onto the vehicle, and then hand-tighten the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle. , to a

tips_notes.content: Make sure that the hinges do not come into contact with the glass to prevent damage.

steps.instruction: Install the spring clips (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper ball studs to the liftgate.

tips_notes.content: Make sure that the spring clip has been reset. Figure 2. LH shown, RH similar

steps.instruction: Route the liftgate harness through the access hole, and then install the grommet to the body.
Connect the liftgate harness connectors (x3).
Install a new bolt that attaches the liftgate harness ground bolt to the liftgate.10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket

steps.instruction: Install the clip and location pin that attach the RH rear edge of the headliner to the vehicle.
Install the rear headliner. See Rear Headliner (Remove and Replace).
Close the liftgate to check gap/flush. With assistance, perform adjustment as necessary to the hinge bolts and trunk striker.

tips_notes.content: Refer to CVIS for latest specifications.

steps.instruction: Open the liftgate.
Tighten the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

steps.instruction: Remove the masking tapes from the vehicle.
Close the liftgate.

torque_specifications.description: Bolt that attaches the liftgate harness ground bolt to the liftgate
Bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle

full_text: Liftgate (Remove and Install) Torque Calculator2025-05-22 Liftgate (Remove and Install) Correction code 1010020401 FRT 0.40 NOTE: Unless otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including the linked procedures. Do not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate Times to learn more about FRTs and how they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com. NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications: Liftgate (Remove and Install) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolt that attaches the liftgate harness ground bolt to the liftgate 10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft) 10 mm socket Replace 1128269-00-A Bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle 24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) 13 mm socket Reuse Remove | Open the liftgate. Use a telescoping hood prop to support the liftgate. Remove the rear headliner. See Rear Headliner (Remove and Replace). Carefully release the clip and location pin that attach the RH rear edge of the headliner to the vehicle. , NoteThis is to gain access to the liftgate harness connectors. Remove and discard the bolt that attaches the liftgate harness ground bolt to the liftgate. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket Disconnect the liftgate harness connectors (x3). Release the RH rear liftgate grommet from the body. Apply masking tape around the liftgate and liftgate hinge to mark the installation positioning. Place shop towels on the LH and RH side liftgate jambs. Release the spring clips (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper ball studs to the liftgate, and then lay the struts down on the door jamb. Figure 1. LH shown, RH similar Remove the telescoping hood prop. With assistance, remove the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle, and then place the liftgate on a stand. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Install | With assistance, position the liftgate onto the vehicle, and then hand-tighten the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle. , to a CAUTIONMake sure that the hinges do not come into contact with the glass to prevent damage. Install the spring clips (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper ball studs to the liftgate. , NoteMake sure that the spring clip has been reset. Figure 2. LH shown, RH similar Route the liftgate harness through the access hole, and then install the grommet to the body. Connect the liftgate harness connectors (x3). Install a new bolt that attaches the liftgate harness ground bolt to the liftgate.10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket Install the clip and location pin that attach the RH rear edge of the headliner to the vehicle. Install the rear headliner. See Rear Headliner (Remove and Replace). Close the liftgate to check gap/flush. With assistance, perform adjustment as necessary to the hinge bolts and trunk striker. , NoteRefer to CVIS for latest specifications. Open the liftgate. Tighten the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Remove the masking tapes from the vehicle. Close the liftgate. title: Liftgate (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Open the LH front door and lower the LH front window.
Open the liftgate.
Remove the LH and RH liftgate lower bump stops. See .
Remove the LH and RH liftgate wedge dampers. See Liftgate Wedge Damper - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Liftgate Wedge Damper - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the LH and RH bumper blocks. See Bump Stop - Liftgate - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Bump Stop - Liftgate - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the LH and RH lower liftgate plugs. Figure 1. LH Shown, RH Similar
Remove the liftgate harness and the harness grommet. See Assembly - Harness - Liftgate - Global (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Assembly - Harness - Liftgate - Global (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Disconnect the backlite glass heater negative connector.
Remove the clip and bolt that attach the RH ground harness to the liftgate assembly.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Remove the liftgate cinch latch. See Liftgate Cinch Latch (Remove and Replace).
Remove the tuned mass damper. See Tuned Mass Damper (Remove and Replace).
Remove the nuts (x3) that attach the base spoiler to the liftgate.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Remove the spoiler outer panel. See Spoiler Outer Panel (Remove and Replace).
Remove the tail lamp. See Tail Lamp - Liftgate (Remove and Install).
Disconnect the liftgate handle switch connector.
Remove the harness liftgate extend from the liftgate assembly.
Remove the backlight glass. See Backlite Glass (Remove and Install).

tips_notes.content: No need to remove the center high mounted brake light from the backlight glass.

steps.instruction: Use a telescoping hood prop to support the liftgate.
Place shop towels on the LH and RH side liftgate jambs.
Release the spring clips (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper ball studs to the liftgate, and then lay the struts down on the door jamb. Figure 2. LH Shown, RH Similar
Remove the telescoping hood prop.

tips_notes.content: Assistance is recommended after removal.

steps.instruction: With assistance, remove the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle, and then place the liftgate on a stand.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

steps.instruction: Remove the LH and RH liftgate ball stud bracket bolts (x2) from the liftgate.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Figure 3. LH Shown, RH Similar

steps.instruction: Remove and discard all spacer pads.
Clean all remaining glass adhesive and spacer pads adhesive from the body and the glass.
With assistance, place the new liftgate on the support stand.
Install the LH and RH liftgate ball stud bracket bolts (x2) to the liftgate.20 Nm (14.7 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Figure 4. LH Shown, RH Similar

steps.instruction: With assistance, hand-tighten the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle. , to a

tips_notes.content: Make sure that the hinges do not come into contact with the glass to prevent damage.

steps.instruction: Secure the spring clips (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper ball studs to the liftgate.

tips_notes.content: Ensure that the spring clip has been reset. Figure 5. LH Shown, RH Similar

steps.instruction: Install the liftgate harness and the harness grommet. See Assembly - Harness - Liftgate - Global (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Assembly - Harness - Liftgate - Global (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the liftgate cinch latch. See Liftgate Cinch Latch (Remove and Replace).
Install the harness liftgate extend to the liftgate assembly, and install the grommet.
Connect the liftgate extend harness connectors (x2).
Connect the liftgate handle switch connector.
Install the tail lamp. See Tail Lamp - Liftgate (Remove and Install).
Install the spoiler outer panel. See Spoiler Outer Panel (Remove and Replace).
Install the nuts (x3) that attach the base spoiler to the liftgate.5 Nm (3.7 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Install the tuned mass damper. See Tuned Mass Damper (Remove and Replace).
Install the LH and RH liftgate wedge dampers. See Liftgate Wedge Damper - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Liftgate Wedge Damper - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the LH and RH bumper blocks. See Bump Stop - Liftgate - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Bump Stop - Liftgate - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the LH and RH liftgate lower bump stops. See .
Install the LH and RH lower liftgate plugs. Figure 6. LH Shown, RH Similar
Close the liftgate to check gap/flush, and perform adjustments as necessary.
Open the liftgate.
Install the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle, and then place the liftgate on a stand.24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

steps.instruction: Apply touch up pain to the head of the LH and RH liftgate hinge bolts as necessary.

tips_notes.content: Make sure to shake the touch up paint before applying. If a 2nd coat is necessary, allow the 1st coat to dry for 20 minutes before applying a 2nd one.

steps.instruction: Install the backlight glass. See Backlite Glass (Remove and Install).
If quipped, install the Chinese Tesla badge. See Badge - Tesla Chinese (Remove and Replace).
Install the Model Y/Model Y+ badge. See Badge - Model Y (Remove and Replace) or Badge - Model Y+ (Remove and Replace).
If quipped, install the Dual Motor badge. See Badge - Dual Motor (Remove and Replace).
Connect the electrical connector, and then install the clip that attaches the center high mounted brake light connector to the body.
Install the clip and bolt that attach the RH ground harness to the liftgate assembly.10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Connect the backlite glass heater negative connector.
Connect the backlight glass heater positive connector.
Install the lower liftgate trim. See Liftgate Lower Trim (Remove and Replace).
Place the vehicle in Service Mode by using the touchscreen. See Service Mode.
Unlock the vehicle gateway. See Gateway (Unlock).

On the touchscreen, tap the Service Mode "wrench" (at the bottom of the touchscreen UI), and then tap Driver Assist > Cameras > Clear Camera Calibration, select RearView in the Camera Selection drop list, click Run, and allow the routine to complete.
Exit Service Mode. See Service Mode.
Raise the LH front window and close the LH front door.
Remove the masking tapes after the urethane has cured. , to a

tips_notes.content: Do not drive the vehicle until the adhesive manufacturerâs recommended minimum drive-away time has passed. Dow Betaseal Express has a drive-away time of 1 hour minimum in temperatures of 0ËF (-18ËC) or warmer. If necessary, leave the tape applying pressure to the glass on the vehicle and advise the customer that they can remove it after 24 hours. Additionally, advise the customer that they should avoid high driving speeds and speed bumps for the next 24 hours.

torque_specifications.description: Bolt that attach the RH ground harness to the liftgate assembly
Nuts (x3) that attach the base spoiler to the liftgate
Bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle
LH and RH liftgate ball stud bracket bolts (x2)

full_text: Liftgate (Remove and Replace) Torque Calculator2025-05-22 Liftgate (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010020402 FRT 2.40 NOTE: Unless otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including the linked procedures. Do not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate Times to learn more about FRTs and how they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com. NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and healthy working practices. 1080562-00-A - TELESCOPING HOOD PROP Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications: Liftgate (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolt that attach the RH ground harness to the liftgate assembly 10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Replace 1128269-00-A Nuts (x3) that attach the base spoiler to the liftgate 5 Nm (3.7 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Reuse Bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle 24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) 13 mm socket Reuse LH and RH liftgate ball stud bracket bolts (x2) 20 Nm (14.7 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket Reuse Remove | Open the LH front door and lower the LH front window. Open the liftgate. Remove the LH and RH liftgate lower bump stops. See . Remove the LH and RH liftgate wedge dampers. See Liftgate Wedge Damper - LH (Remove and Replace). Remove the LH and RH bumper blocks. See Bump Stop - Liftgate - LH (Remove and Replace). Remove the LH and RH lower liftgate plugs. Figure 1. LH Shown, RH Similar Remove the liftgate harness and the harness grommet. See Assembly - Harness - Liftgate - Global (Remove and Replace). Disconnect the backlite glass heater negative connector. Remove the clip and bolt that attach the RH ground harness to the liftgate assembly. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the liftgate cinch latch. See Liftgate Cinch Latch (Remove and Replace). Remove the tuned mass damper. See Tuned Mass Damper (Remove and Replace). Remove the nuts (x3) that attach the base spoiler to the liftgate. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the spoiler outer panel. See Spoiler Outer Panel (Remove and Replace). Remove the tail lamp. See Tail Lamp - Liftgate (Remove and Install). Disconnect the liftgate handle switch connector. Remove the harness liftgate extend from the liftgate assembly. Remove the backlight glass. See Backlite Glass (Remove and Install). , NoteNo need to remove the center high mounted brake light from the backlight glass. Use a telescoping hood prop to support the liftgate. Place shop towels on the LH and RH side liftgate jambs. Release the spring clips (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper ball studs to the liftgate, and then lay the struts down on the door jamb. Figure 2. LH Shown, RH Similar Remove the telescoping hood prop. , NoteAssistance is recommended after removal. With assistance, remove the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle, and then place the liftgate on a stand. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Remove the LH and RH liftgate ball stud bracket bolts (x2) from the liftgate. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Figure 3. LH Shown, RH Similar Remove and discard all spacer pads. Clean all remaining glass adhesive and spacer pads adhesive from the body and the glass. Install | With assistance, place the new liftgate on the support stand. Install the LH and RH liftgate ball stud bracket bolts (x2) to the liftgate.20 Nm (14.7 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Figure 4. LH Shown, RH Similar With assistance, hand-tighten the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle. , to a CAUTIONMake sure that the hinges do not come into contact with the glass to prevent damage. Secure the spring clips (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper ball studs to the liftgate. , NoteEnsure that the spring clip has been reset. Figure 5. LH Shown, RH Similar Install the liftgate harness and the harness grommet. See Assembly - Harness - Liftgate - Global (Remove and Replace). Install the liftgate cinch latch. See Liftgate Cinch Latch (Remove and Replace). Install the harness liftgate extend to the liftgate assembly, and install the grommet. Connect the liftgate extend harness connectors (x2). Connect the liftgate handle switch connector. Install the tail lamp. See Tail Lamp - Liftgate (Remove and Install). Install the spoiler outer panel. See Spoiler Outer Panel (Remove and Replace). Install the nuts (x3) that attach the base spoiler to the liftgate.5 Nm (3.7 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Install the tuned mass damper. See Tuned Mass Damper (Remove and Replace). Install the LH and RH liftgate wedge dampers. See Liftgate Wedge Damper - LH (Remove and Replace). Install the LH and RH bumper blocks. See Bump Stop - Liftgate - LH (Remove and Replace). Install the LH and RH liftgate lower bump stops. See . Install the LH and RH lower liftgate plugs. Figure 6. LH Shown, RH Similar Close the liftgate to check gap/flush, and perform adjustments as necessary. Open the liftgate. Install the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle, and then place the liftgate on a stand.24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Apply touch up pain to the head of the LH and RH liftgate hinge bolts as necessary. , NoteMake sure to shake the touch up paint before applying. If a 2nd coat is necessary, allow the 1st coat to dry for 20 minutes before applying a 2nd one. Install the backlight glass. See Backlite Glass (Remove and Install). If quipped, install the Chinese Tesla badge. See Badge - Tesla Chinese (Remove and Replace). Install the Model Y/Model Y+ badge. See Badge - Model Y (Remove and Replace) or Badge - Model Y+ (Remove and Replace). If quipped, install the Dual Motor badge. See Badge - Dual Motor (Remove and Replace). Connect the electrical connector, and then install the clip that attaches the center high mounted brake light connector to the body. Install the clip and bolt that attach the RH ground harness to the liftgate assembly.10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Connect the backlite glass heater negative connector. Connect the backlight glass heater positive connector. Install the lower liftgate trim. See Liftgate Lower Trim (Remove and Replace). Place the vehicle in Service Mode by using the touchscreen. See Service Mode. Unlock the vehicle gateway. See Gateway (Unlock). On the touchscreen, tap the Service Mode "wrench" (at the bottom of the touchscreen UI), and then tap Driver Assist > Cameras > Clear Camera Calibration, select RearView in the Camera Selection drop list, click Run, and allow the routine to complete. Exit Service Mode. See Service Mode. Raise the LH front window and close the LH front door. Remove the masking tapes after the urethane has cured. , to a CAUTIONDo not drive the vehicle until the adhesive manufacturerâs recommended minimum drive-away time has passed. Dow Betaseal Express has a drive-away time of 1 hour minimum in temperatures of 0ËF (-18ËC) or warmer. If necessary, leave the tape applying pressure to the glass on the vehicle and advise the customer that they can remove it after 24 hours. Additionally, advise the customer that they should avoid high driving speeds and speed bumps for the next 24 hours.
