title: Lower Trunk (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the trunk sill trim. See Trunk Sill Lower Trim (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Trunk Sill Lower Trim (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the LH and RH load floor brackets. See Bracket - Load Floor - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Bracket - Load Floor - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove trunk tub. See Trunk Tub (Remove and Replace).
Remove bottom foam pad from lower trunk.
Remove rear center bolt from lower trunk assembly.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket

steps.instruction: Remove lower trunk assembly from vehicle.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

steps.instruction: Install lower trunk assembly onto vehicle.10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

steps.instruction: Install rear center bolt onto lower trunk assembly.24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

steps.instruction: Install bottom foam pad to lower trunk.
Install trunk tub. See Trunk Tub (Remove and Replace).
Install the LH and RH load floor brackets. See Bracket - Load Floor - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Bracket - Load Floor - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the trunk sill trim. See Trunk Sill Lower Trim (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Trunk Sill Lower Trim (Remove and Replace)

torque_specifications.description: Rear center bolt
Bolts (x4) attach lower trunk assembly to vehicle

full_text: Lower Trunk (Remove and Replace) Torque Calculator2025-03-12 Lower Trunk (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010060102 FRT 0.12 NOTE: Unless otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including the linked procedures. Do not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate Times to learn more about FRTs and how they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com. NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and healthy working practices. Table 1. Torque Specifications:Lower Trunk (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Rear center bolt 10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft) 10 mm socket Replace Bolts (x4) attach lower trunk assembly to vehicle 24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) 13 mm socket Replace Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Remove | Remove the trunk sill trim. See Trunk Sill Lower Trim (Remove and Replace). Remove the LH and RH load floor brackets. See Bracket - Load Floor - LH (Remove and Replace). Remove trunk tub. See Trunk Tub (Remove and Replace). Remove bottom foam pad from lower trunk. Remove rear center bolt from lower trunk assembly. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket Remove lower trunk assembly from vehicle. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Install | Install lower trunk assembly onto vehicle.10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Install rear center bolt onto lower trunk assembly.24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Install bottom foam pad to lower trunk. Install trunk tub. See Trunk Tub (Remove and Replace). Install the LH and RH load floor brackets. See Bracket - Load Floor - LH (Remove and Replace). Install the trunk sill trim. See Trunk Sill Lower Trim (Remove and Replace). title: Panel - Rear End (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Place the vehicle on the 2-post lift.

tips_notes.content: Ensure the vehicle is not charging.

steps.instruction: Remove both rear fender garnishes. See Fender Garnish - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Fender Garnish - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the trunk tub. See Trunk Tub (Remove and Replace).
Remove and discard the rear center bolt from the lower trunk assembly.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket

steps.instruction: Remove the rear side bolts (x2) from the lower trunk assembly.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

steps.instruction: Remove the rear fascia and diffuser assembly. See Assembly - Fascia and Diffuser - Rear (Remove and Install).

hyperlinks.text: Assembly - Fascia and Diffuser - Rear (Remove and Install)

steps.instruction: Remove rear bumper beam from the vehicle. See Rear Bumper Beam (Remove and Replace)
Remove rear fascia center bracket from the vehicle. See Bracket - Center - Rear Fascia (Remove and Replace)

hyperlinks.text: Bracket - Center - Rear Fascia (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove liftgate striker from the vehicle. See Striker - Liftgate (Remove and Replace)
Remove bolts (x2) that attach the rear end panel to the body.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket

steps.instruction: Slide outward to remove the rear end panel from the rear of the vehicle.
Align the holes (x2) on the rear end panel to the locating pins (x2) on the body to install the panel.
Install the bolts (x2) that attach the rear end panel to the body.10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket

steps.instruction: Install rear fascia center bracket to the vehicle. See Bracket - Center - Rear Fascia (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Bracket - Center - Rear Fascia (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install rear bumper beam to the vehicle. See Rear Bumper Beam (Remove and Replace).
Install the rear fascia and diffuser assembly. See Assembly - Fascia and Diffuser - Rear (Remove and Install).

hyperlinks.text: Assembly - Fascia and Diffuser - Rear (Remove and Install)

steps.instruction: Install a new rear center bolt to the lower trunk assembly.10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket

steps.instruction: Install the rear side bolts (x2) from the lower trunk assembly.24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

steps.instruction: Install the trunk tub. See Trunk Tub (Remove and Replace).
Install liftgate striker to the vehicle. See Striker - Liftgate (Remove and Replace).

torque_specifications.description: Bolts (x2) that attach the rear end panel to the body
Lower trunk assembly rear center bolt
Lower trunk assembly rear side bolts (x2)

title: Pencil Brace - Wiper Bracket - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the cowl screen. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace).
Remove the bolts (x2) that attaches the LH wiper bracket pencil brace to the body, and then remove the brace from the vehicle.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Hand-tighten the bolts (x2) that attaches the LH wiper bracket pencil brace to the body, and then torque them.27 Nm (19.9 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Install the cowl screen. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace).

torque_specifications.description: Bolts (x2) that attaches the LH/RH wiper bracket pencil brace to the body

full_text: Pencil Brace - Wiper Bracket - LH (Remove and Replace) Torque Calculator2025-11-06 Pencil Brace - Wiper Bracket - LH (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010055202 FRT 0.24 NOTE: Unless otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including the linked procedures. Do not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate Times to learn more about FRTs and how they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com. NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and healthy working practices. 2025-11-04: Updated the torque of the NVH brace bolts (x2) from 18.8 Nm to 27 Nm. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace). Remove the bolts (x2) that attaches the LH wiper bracket pencil brace to the body, and then remove the brace from the vehicle. , Note Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Install | Hand-tighten the bolts (x2) that attaches the LH wiper bracket pencil brace to the body, and then torque them.27 Nm (19.9 lbs-ft) , Note Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Install the cowl screen. title: Pencil Brace - Wiper Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the cowl screen. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace).
Remove the bolts (x2) that attaches the RH wiper bracket pencil brace to the body, and then remove the brace from the vehicle.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Hand-tighten the bolts (x2) that attaches the RH wiper bracket pencil brace to the body, and then torque them.27 Nm (19.9 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Be careful not to damage the windshield.
Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Install the cowl screen. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace).

torque_specifications.description: Bolts (x2) that attaches the LH/RH wiper bracket pencil brace to the body

Do not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate Times to learn more about FRTs and how they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com. NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and healthy working practices. 2025-11-04: Updated the torque of the NVH brace bolts (x2) from 18.8 Nm to 27 Nm. title: Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Install)

steps.instruction: Open the LH doors and lower the LH windows.
Place the vehicle in Service Mode by using the touchscreen. See Service Mode.
Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify).
Release the grommet between the 2 hinges, and then release the clips (x2) that attach the electrical harness connector to the door to disconnect the harness from the B-pillar area.

tips_notes.content: Release the top clip at first, and then while pressing the top one, release the bottom clip.

steps.instruction: Use tape to mark the position of the LH rear door hinges and the LH rear door check strap. Figure 1. Check Strap Area as Example
Remove the bolt that attaches the LH rear door check strap to the body.

tips_notes.content: Unbolting the door check allows the door to swing freely beyond opening limits.
Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket 4 in extension

steps.instruction: With assistance, loosen the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges, and then fully remove the bottom bolt, then fully remove the top bolt.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: With assistance, remove the LH rear door assembly from the vehicle, and place it on a padded surface.
Torx T40 socket
4 in extension
With assistance, position the LH rear door assembly to the vehicle.
With assistance, hand-tighten the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges.
Install the bolt that attaches the LH rear door check strap to the body.24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket 4 in extension

steps.instruction: Verify the seal is fully seated around the white clips.
Secure the clips (x2) that attach the electrical harness connector to the door until there is an audible click, and then seat the grommet into position.

tips_notes.content: Gently pull the harness to ensure the connector is fully secure.

steps.instruction: Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify).
Close the LH rear door to check for gap/flushness.

tips_notes.content: Adjust the LH rear door if necessary. Refer to CVIS for current specification.

steps.instruction: Open the LH rear door.
With assistance, torque the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges.49 Nm (36.1 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Remove all masking tapes.
Raise the LH rear window and lower the LH rear door.
Unlock the vehicle gateway. See Gateway (Unlock).
On the touchscreen, tap the Service Mode "wrench" (at the bottom of the touchscreen UI), and then tap Closures > Windows > Rear Left Calibrate, click Run, and allow the routine to complete.
Exit Service Mode. See Service Mode.
Raise the LH front window and close the LH front door.
Torx T40 socket
4 in extension

torque_specifications.description: Bolt that attaches the LH rear door check strap to the body
Bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges

Torque Specifications: Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Install) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolt that attaches the LH rear door check strap to the body 24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) Torx T40 socket 4 in extension Reuse Bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges 49 Nm (36.1 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket Reuse Remove | Open the LH doors and lower the LH windows. Place the vehicle in Service Mode by using the touchscreen. See Service Mode. Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify). Release the grommet between the 2 hinges, and then release the clips (x2) that attach the electrical harness connector to the door to disconnect the harness from the B-pillar area. , NoteRelease the top clip at first, and then while pressing the top one, release the bottom clip. Use tape to mark the position of the LH rear door hinges and the LH rear door check strap. Figure 1. Check Strap Area as Example Remove the bolt that attaches the LH rear door check strap to the body. , NoteUnbolting the door check allows the door to swing freely beyond opening limits. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket 4 in extension With assistance, loosen the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges, and then fully remove the bottom bolt, then fully remove the top bolt. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket With assistance, remove the LH rear door assembly from the vehicle, and place it on a padded surface. Install | With assistance, position the LH rear door assembly to the vehicle. With assistance, hand-tighten the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges. Install the bolt that attaches the LH rear door check strap to the body.24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket 4 in extension Verify the seal is fully seated around the white clips. Secure the clips (x2) that attach the electrical harness connector to the door until there is an audible click, and then seat the grommet into position. , NoteGently pull the harness to ensure the connector is fully secure. Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify). Close the LH rear door to check for gap/flushness. , NoteAdjust the LH rear door if necessary. Refer to CVIS for current specification. Open the LH rear door. With assistance, torque the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges.49 Nm (36.1 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Remove all masking tapes. Raise the LH rear window and lower the LH rear door. Unlock the vehicle gateway. See Gateway (Unlock). On the touchscreen, tap the Service Mode "wrench" (at the bottom of the touchscreen UI), and then tap Closures > Windows > Rear Left Calibrate, click Run, and allow the routine to complete. Exit Service Mode. See Service Mode. Raise the LH front window and close the LH front door. title: Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Window Switch Tool - 1454796-00-B
BODY GAP & FLUSH GAUGE, MODEL Y - 1588903-00-A
SECONDARY SEAL, REAR DOOR, LH, MY - 1500060-00-B or
SECONDARY SEAL, REAR DOOR, RH, MY - 1500061-00-B
Place the vehicle in Service Mode by using the touchscreen. See Service Mode.
Remove the HEPA filter assembly. See HEPA Filter Assembly (Remove and Replace).
Remove the LH rear door outer belt. See Outer Belt - Rear Door - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Outer Belt - Rear Door - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the LH rear door trim panel. See Door Trim - Rear - LH (Remove and Install).

hyperlinks.text: Door Trim - Rear - LH (Remove and Install)

steps.instruction: Remove the LH rear door window glass. See Glass - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Glass - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify).
Disconnect the electrical harness from the LH rear window motor.
Disconnect the electrical harness from the LH rear door pressure sensor.
Release the clip that attaches the manual latch release cable to the LH rear window closeout assembly.
Release the clips (x3) that attach the LH rear door harness to the LH rear window closeout assembly.
Remove the plugs (x2) that cover the LH rear window closeout assembly rail fasteners.
Remove the screws (x2) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Remove the bolts (x11) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door, and then gently lift the closeout assembly upwards to release the datums and angle the bottom of the assembly from the door. , to a

tips_notes.content: Never loosen or remove the nuts (x4) that attach the regulator arms to the assembly closeout panel.
Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 8 mm socket

steps.instruction: Disconnect the LH rear outer door handle connector.
Disconnect the LH rear door electrical harness from the LH rear door latch connector.
Release the harness clips (x7) from the LH rear door.
Release the grommet between the 2 hinges, and then release the clips (x2) that attach the electrical harness connector to the door to disconnect the harness from the B-pillar area.

tips_notes.content: Release the top clip at first, and then while pressing the top one, release the bottom clip.

steps.instruction: Remove the rubber grommet from the LH rear door assembly.
Remove the clip bases (x10) from the LH rear door.
Remove the LH rear door latch. See Door Latch - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Door Latch - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the LH rear outer door handle. See Handle - Exterior Release - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Handle - Exterior Release - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Remove the LH rear door check strap. See Check Strap - Rear (Remove and Replace).
With assistance, loosen the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges, and then fully remove the bottom bolt, then fully remove the top bolt.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: With assistance, remove the LH rear door assembly from the vehicle, and place it on a padded surface.
With assistance, position the LH rear door assembly to the vehicle.
With assistance, hand-tighten the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges.
Install the LH rear door check strap. See Check Strap - Rear (Remove and Replace).
Install the LH rear outer door handle. See Handle - Exterior Release - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Handle - Exterior Release - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the LH rear door latch. See Door Latch - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Door Latch - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the clip bases (x10) to the LH rear door.
Install the rubber grommet to the LH rear door assembly.
Verify the seal is fully seated around the white clips.
Secure the clips (x2) that attach the electrical harness connector to the door until there is an audible click, and then seat the grommet into position.

tips_notes.content: Gently pull the harness to ensure the connector is fully secure.

steps.instruction: Install the harness clips (x7) to the LH rear door.
Connect the LH rear door electrical harness to the LH rear door latch connector.
Connect the LH rear outer door handle connector.
Install the LH rear window closeout assembly up and into the LH rear door, and then install the datums that attach the closeout assembly to the LH rear door.
Install the screws (x11) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door.4.5 Nm (3.3 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 8 mm socket

steps.instruction: Install the screws (x2) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door.10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Install the plugs (x2) that cover the LH rear window closeout assembly rail fasteners.
Fasten the clips (x3) that attach the LH rear door harness to the LH rear window closeout assembly.
Connect the electrical harness to the LH rear door pressure sensor.
Connect the electrical harness to the LH rear window closeout assembly.
Install the clip that attaches the manual latch release cable to the LH rear window closeout assembly.
Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify).
Close the LH rear door to check for gap/flushness.

tips_notes.content: Adjust the LH rear door if necessary. Refer to CVIS for current specification.

steps.instruction: Open the LH rear door.
With assistance, torque the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges.49 Nm (36.1 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Install the LH rear door outer belt. See Outer Belt - Rear Door - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Outer Belt - Rear Door - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Install the LH rear door window glass. See Glass - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Glass - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Use IPA wipes to clean the area where the secondary seal will be installed.
Peel back the adhesive backing of the secondary seal and position the seal onto the rear section of the LH rear door.

tips_notes.content: Ensure the drain holes of the seal are at the bottom of the door. Ensure both edges are under the cut-outs for the inner belt seal and glass run seal. Ensure the open edge of the seal is facing the inside of the door.

steps.instruction: Firmly press the seal into place while removing the film from the double-sided tape.

tips_notes.content: Ensure the seal is even all the way around the edge of the door. Align the seal with the positioning tape when pasting.

steps.instruction: Install the LH rear door inner belt seal. See Inner Belt Seal - Rear Door - LH (Remove and Replace).

hyperlinks.text: Inner Belt Seal - Rear Door - LH (Remove and Replace)

steps.instruction: Release the LH rear door latch.
Raise the LH rear window and close the LH rear door.
Check the LH rear window for gap/flushness.

tips_notes.content: Adjust the LH rear window with assistance if necessary. The gap should be 8.0 Â±1.75 mm and the flushness should be 0.0 Â±2.0 mm.

steps.instruction: Open the LH rear door.
Close the LH rear door latch to allow the window height adjustment.

tips_notes.content: Do not close the door with the window fully raised, as the upper bright trim will be damaged.

steps.instruction: Adjust the glass for access to the regulator guide blocks.
Loosen the bolts (x2) that attach the window glass to the regulator guide blocks about half a turn to maintain the position but still allow adjustment.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Adjust the front of the moving glass to achieve the flush target to the B-Pillar applique.

tips_notes.content: Use a 5mm hex socket to adjust the friction pad to tilt the glass inboard or outboard. Turn clockwise to achieve outboard adjustments and turn counter-clockwise to achieve inboard adjustments.

steps.instruction: Adjust the rear of the moving glass to achieve the flush target to the quarter glass assembly.

tips_notes.content: Use a 5mm hex socket to adjust the friction pad to tilt the glass inboard or outboard. Turn clockwise to achieve outboard adjustments and turn counter-clockwise to achieve inboard adjustments.

steps.instruction: Hand-tighten the bolts (x2) that attach the window glass to the regulator guide blocks.

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Release the LH rear door latch.
Close the LH rear door.
Check the LH rear window for gap/flushness.

tips_notes.content: Adjust the LH rear window with assistance if necessary. The gap should be 8.0 Â±1.75 mm and the flushness should be 0.0 Â±2.0 mm.

steps.instruction: Open the LH rear door.
Close the LH rear door latch to allow the window height adjustment.

tips_notes.content: Do not close the door with the window fully raised, as the upper bright trim will be damaged.

steps.instruction: Adjust the glass for access to the regulator guide blocks.
Torque the bolts (x2) that attach the window glass to the regulator guide blocks.12 Nm (8.8 lbs-ft)

tips_notes.content: Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

steps.instruction: Install the plugs that cover the openings into the door.
Release the LH rear door latch.
Fully lower the window, and disconnect the window switch special tool from the LH rear door harness.
Install the LH rear door trim panel. See Door Trim - Rear - LH (Remove and Install).

hyperlinks.text: Door Trim - Rear - LH (Remove and Install)

steps.instruction: Unlock the vehicle gateway. See Gateway (Unlock).
On the touchscreen, tap the Service Mode "wrench" (at the bottom of the touchscreen UI), and then tap Closures > Windows > Rear Left Calibrate, click Run, and allow the routine to complete.
Exit Service Mode. See Service Mode.
Raise the LH front window and close the LH front door.

torque_specifications.description: Screws (x2) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door
Bolts (x11) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door
Bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges
Bolts (x2) that attach the window glass to the regulator guide blocks

full_text: Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) Torque Calculator2025-07-01 Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010020502 FRT 1.20 NOTE: Unless otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including the linked procedures. Do not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate Times to learn more about FRTs and how they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com. NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and healthy working practices. 2025-07-01: Added part numbers for rear door secondary seal. Window Switch Tool - 1454796-00-B BODY GAP & FLUSH GAUGE, MODEL Y - 1588903-00-A SECONDARY SEAL, REAR DOOR, LH, MY - 1500060-00-B or SECONDARY SEAL, REAR DOOR, RH, MY - 1500061-00-B Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications: Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Screws (x2) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door 10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Reuse Bolts (x11) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door 4.5 Nm (3.3 lbs-ft) 8 mm socket Reuse Bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges 49 Nm (36.1 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket Reuse Bolts (x2) that attach the window glass to the regulator guide blocks 12 Nm (8.8 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Reuse Remove | Place the vehicle in Service Mode by using the touchscreen. See Service Mode. Remove the HEPA filter assembly. See HEPA Filter Assembly (Remove and Replace). Remove the LH rear door outer belt. See Outer Belt - Rear Door - LH (Remove and Replace). Remove the LH rear door trim panel. See Door Trim - Rear - LH (Remove and Install). Remove the LH rear door window glass. See Glass - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace). Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify). Disconnect the electrical harness from the LH rear window motor. Disconnect the electrical harness from the LH rear door pressure sensor. Release the clip that attaches the manual latch release cable to the LH rear window closeout assembly. Release the clips (x3) that attach the LH rear door harness to the LH rear window closeout assembly. Remove the plugs (x2) that cover the LH rear window closeout assembly rail fasteners. Remove the screws (x2) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the bolts (x11) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door, and then gently lift the closeout assembly upwards to release the datums and angle the bottom of the assembly from the door. , to a CAUTIONNever loosen or remove the nuts (x4) that attach the regulator arms to the assembly closeout panel. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 8 mm socket Disconnect the LH rear outer door handle connector. Disconnect the LH rear door electrical harness from the LH rear door latch connector. Release the harness clips (x7) from the LH rear door. Release the grommet between the 2 hinges, and then release the clips (x2) that attach the electrical harness connector to the door to disconnect the harness from the B-pillar area. , NoteRelease the top clip at first, and then while pressing the top one, release the bottom clip. Remove the rubber grommet from the LH rear door assembly. Remove the clip bases (x10) from the LH rear door. Remove the LH rear door latch. See Door Latch - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace). Remove the LH rear outer door handle. See Handle - Exterior Release - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace). Remove the LH rear door check strap. See Check Strap - Rear (Remove and Replace). With assistance, loosen the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges, and then fully remove the bottom bolt, then fully remove the top bolt. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket With assistance, remove the LH rear door assembly from the vehicle, and place it on a padded surface. Install | With assistance, position the LH rear door assembly to the vehicle. With assistance, hand-tighten the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges. Install the LH rear door check strap. See Check Strap - Rear (Remove and Replace). Install the LH rear outer door handle. See Handle - Exterior Release - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace). Install the LH rear door latch. See Door Latch - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace). Install the clip bases (x10) to the LH rear door. Install the rubber grommet to the LH rear door assembly. Verify the seal is fully seated around the white clips. Secure the clips (x2) that attach the electrical harness connector to the door until there is an audible click, and then seat the grommet into position. , NoteGently pull the harness to ensure the connector is fully secure. Install the harness clips (x7) to the LH rear door. Connect the LH rear door electrical harness to the LH rear door latch connector. Connect the LH rear outer door handle connector. Install the LH rear window closeout assembly up and into the LH rear door, and then install the datums that attach the closeout assembly to the LH rear door. Install the screws (x11) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door.4.5 Nm (3.3 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 8 mm socket Install the screws (x2) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door.10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Install the plugs (x2) that cover the LH rear window closeout assembly rail fasteners. Fasten the clips (x3) that attach the LH rear door harness to the LH rear window closeout assembly. Connect the electrical harness to the LH rear door pressure sensor. Connect the electrical harness to the LH rear window closeout assembly. Install the clip that attaches the manual latch release cable to the LH rear window closeout assembly. Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify). Close the LH rear door to check for gap/flushness. , NoteAdjust the LH rear door if necessary. Refer to CVIS for current specification. Open the LH rear door. With assistance, torque the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges.49 Nm (36.1 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Install the LH rear door outer belt. See Outer Belt - Rear Door - LH (Remove and Replace). Install the LH rear door window glass. See Glass - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace). Use IPA wipes to clean the area where the secondary seal will be installed. Peel back the adhesive backing of the secondary seal and position the seal onto the rear section of the LH rear door. , NoteEnsure the drain holes of the seal are at the bottom of the door. Ensure both edges are under the cut-outs for the inner belt seal and glass run seal. Ensure the open edge of the seal is facing the inside of the door. Firmly press the seal into place while removing the film from the double-sided tape. , NoteEnsure the seal is even all the way around the edge of the door. Align the seal with the positioning tape when pasting. Install the LH rear door inner belt seal. See Inner Belt Seal - Rear Door - LH (Remove and Replace). Release the LH rear door latch. Raise the LH rear window and close the LH rear door. Check the LH rear window for gap/flushness. , NoteAdjust the LH rear window with assistance if necessary. The gap should be 8.0 Â±1.75 mm and the flushness should be 0.0 Â±2.0 mm. Open the LH rear door. Close the LH rear door latch to allow the window height adjustment. , NoteDo not close the door with the window fully raised, as the upper bright trim will be damaged. Adjust the glass for access to the regulator guide blocks. Loosen the bolts (x2) that attach the window glass to the regulator guide blocks about half a turn to maintain the position but still allow adjustment. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Adjust the front of the moving glass to achieve the flush target to the B-Pillar applique. , NoteUse a 5mm hex socket to adjust the friction pad to tilt the glass inboard or outboard. Turn clockwise to achieve outboard adjustments and turn counter-clockwise to achieve inboard adjustments. Adjust the rear of the moving glass to achieve the flush target to the quarter glass assembly. , NoteUse a 5mm hex socket to adjust the friction pad to tilt the glass inboard or outboard. Turn clockwise to achieve outboard adjustments and turn counter-clockwise to achieve inboard adjustments. Hand-tighten the bolts (x2) that attach the window glass to the regulator guide blocks. , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Release the LH rear door latch. Close the LH rear door. Check the LH rear window for gap/flushness. , NoteAdjust the LH rear window with assistance if necessary. The gap should be 8.0 Â±1.75 mm and the flushness should be 0.0 Â±2.0 mm. Open the LH rear door. Close the LH rear door latch to allow the window height adjustment. , NoteDo not close the door with the window fully raised, as the upper bright trim will be damaged. Adjust the glass for access to the regulator guide blocks. Torque the bolts (x2) that attach the window glass to the regulator guide blocks.12 Nm (8.8 lbs-ft) , TIp Use of the following tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Install the plugs that cover the openings into the door. Release the LH rear door latch. Fully lower the window, and disconnect the window switch special tool from the LH rear door harness. Install the LH rear door trim panel. See Door Trim - Rear - LH (Remove and Install). Unlock the vehicle gateway. See Gateway (Unlock). On the touchscreen, tap the Service Mode "wrench" (at the bottom of the touchscreen UI), and then tap Closures > Windows > Rear Left Calibrate, click Run, and allow the routine to complete. Exit Service Mode. See Service Mode. Raise the LH front window and close the LH front door.
